titleInfo.title: National Conservation Exposition at Chilhowee Park, 1913. Knoxville, TN. September 25, 1913. Negro Building.
Negro Building, Chilhowee Park, Knoxville, Tennessee

originInfo.publisher: McClung Historical Collection, Knox County Public Library

location.physicalLocation: Digital Initiatives, James E. Walker Library, Middle Tennessee State University

mods.abstract: White building on a wooded site facing a lake, with "Negro Building" placard over the doorway and two United States flags flying from rooftop. Women in long white dresses, men in dark suits and hats, and children are walking about.

titleInfo.title: Thompson Photograph Collection, McClung Historical Collection

mods.accessCondition: Copyright of the creator Reproduction permitted for non-profit educational and research purposes only. All reproductions require acknowledgement of the contributing institution. For research inquiries about specific objects, contact the McClung Historical Collection, Knox County Public Library.

relatedItem.abstract: Tennessee’s history between the end of the American Civil War (1865) and the end of World War II (1945) often gets ignored. Citizenship—what that has meant and how that has changed—is at the heart of this digital exploration into Tennessee history and culture “between the wars." The stories you can explore through the objects, songs, photographs, paintings, and documents of this website are often those of challenges and obstacles placed before those who pursued the rights and benefits of citizenship.

mods.note: Digital Initiatives, James E. Walker Library, Middle Tennessee State University
